GT.content: Derrida “apologizes” for long detour, explains that it marks the step of 2 men in “Counterfeit Money,” rhythm of every incalculable scene of the gift
GT.linkedContent: Derrida “apologizes” for long detour, explains that it marks the step of 2 men in “Counterfeit Money,” rhythm of every incalculable scene of the gift

FSW.content: difference btwn pleasure/reality principle: original possibility of economy of death, of detour, deferral
FSW.linkedContent: difference btwn pleasure/reality principle: original possibility of economy of death, of detour, deferral

FSW.content: for Freud, deferral, detour (Aufschub), death at origin of life [death drive?] defending itself against death via economy of death, the attempt to douse the pain of an original breach
FSW.linkedContent: for Freud, deferral, detour (Aufschub), death at origin of life [death drive?] defending itself against death via economy of death, the attempt to douse the pain of an original breach

PPHS.content: Vorstellung, delegate of and reference to the other, representative detour
PPHS.linkedContent: Vorstellung, delegate of and reference to the other, representative detour

F.content: cryptonymic translations, art of chicanery, judicial pettifogging, hidden doors, detours > seduces, discourages, fascinates, fatigues
F.linkedContent: cryptonymic translations, art of chicanery, judicial pettifogging, hidden doors, detours > seduces, discourages, fascinates, fatigues

WM.content: since, for Aristotle, mimēsis is not identity but gives us to see in action what is not to be seen in action, only in its resembling double, its mimēma, Derrida wants to leave open this energetic absence, this enigmatic division, the interval which makes scenes and tells tales
WM.linkedContent: since, for Aristotle, mimēsis is not identity but gives us to see in action what is not to be seen in action, only in its resembling double, its mimēma, Derrida wants to leave open this energetic absence, this enigmatic division, the interval which makes scenes and tells tales

WM.content: for Aristotle, if metaphor, risk and chance of mimēsis, can miss the true, it is because metaphor must count w/ a determined absence [moment of detour]
WM.linkedContent: for Aristotle, if metaphor, risk and chance of mimēsis, can miss the true, it is because metaphor must count w/ a determined absence [moment of detour]

WM.content: as moment of detour in which truth might still be lost, metaphor belongs to mimēsis, fold of physis, veiling, when nature has yet to re-find its proper nudity
WM.linkedContent: as moment of detour in which truth might still be lost, metaphor belongs to mimēsis, fold of physis, veiling, when nature has yet to re-find its proper nudity

WM.content: in response to Fontanier’s new “proper sense,” a violent catachresis, btwn figurative and primitive sense, Derrida says: when the middle is not a passageway of mediation btwn oppositions, the opposition is not pertinent > consequences are boundless
WM.linkedContent: in response to Fontanier’s new “proper sense,” a violent catachresis, btwn figurative and primitive sense, Derrida says: when the middle is not a passageway of mediation btwn oppositions, the opposition is not pertinent > consequences are boundless

DIF.content: in Beyond Pleas…, difference btwn pleasure/reality principle is only differance as detour [if “only,” then not differance as relation to impossible presence?]
DIF.linkedContent: in Beyond Pleas…, difference btwn pleasure/reality principle is only differance as detour [if “only,” then not differance as relation to impossible presence?]

O.content: le détour d’une écriture dont one ne revient pas, dissemination: this question calls for restaging of arithmos, “counting” as “bad procedure,” and rereading the rhythmos of Democritus, which philosophy has never been able to reckon w/ (n’aura pu compter) > philosophy accounts for itself by rising out of, and then circulating w/in its speculative necessity, the [envelope of writing]
O.linkedContent: le détour d’une écriture dont one ne revient pas, dissemination: this question calls for restaging of arithmos, “counting” as “bad procedure,” and rereading the rhythmos of Democritus, which philosophy has never been able to reckon w/ (n’aura pu compter) > philosophy accounts for itself by rising out of, and then circulating w/in its speculative necessity, the [envelope of writing]

AFR.content: after Condillac admits he had to take great detours, Derrida explains that the sign is the name of this detour, experience itself as detour, generation of suppléance to be retraced
AFR.linkedContent: after Condillac admits he had to take great detours, Derrida explains that the sign is the name of this detour, experience itself as detour, generation of suppléance to be retraced

PSSS.content: Freud on indirect methods to combat war, ruse of detour (Umweg)
PSSS.linkedContent: Freud on indirect methods to combat war, ruse of detour (Umweg)

PSSS.content: Freud advocates submitting life of drives to Diktatur der Vernunft, a Utopia > indirect stratagem of Eros/Thanatos: contrary to the cruelty drive, though cruelty knows no end
PSSS.linkedContent: Freud advocates submitting life of drives to Diktatur der Vernunft, a Utopia > indirect stratagem of Eros/Thanatos: contrary to the cruelty drive, though cruelty knows no end

PSSS.content: Freud’s indirection, oblique, angular, mediating nonstraightness: not just detour, strategic ruse, continuous transaction—but a leap, interruption, an ethical step
PSSS.linkedContent: Freud’s indirection, oblique, angular, mediating nonstraightness: not just detour, strategic ruse, continuous transaction—but a leap, interruption, an ethical step

PSSS.content: for Freud, force against force, deferred economy of force: makes right (passage from violence to law)
PSSS.linkedContent: for Freud, force against force, deferred economy of force: makes right (passage from violence to law)

D.content: transformations of meaning hinge on certain squaring of text, obligatory passage through open surface, detour through empty square, around the column of fire
D.linkedContent: transformations of meaning hinge on certain squaring of text, obligatory passage through open surface, detour through empty square, around the column of fire

OG.content: history and knowledge (istoria and epistémè) > detours for the purpose of (en vue de) reappropriating presence
OG.linkedContent: history and knowledge (istoria and epistémè) > detours for the purpose of (en vue de) reappropriating presence

OG.content: for Rousseau, writing in North, cold, reasoning, turned toward death, tour de force, detour of force qui s’efforce à garder la vie > history effaces vowel accent, extends power of writing
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, writing in North, cold, reasoning, turned toward death, tour de force, detour of force qui s’efforce à garder la vie > history effaces vowel accent, extends power of writing

OG.content: for Rousseau, le plein air—voice, nature, franc parler, absence of detour
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, le plein air—voice, nature, franc parler, absence of detour

CIR.content: foreskin & truth (detour/delay): question of knowing by whom by what the violence of circumcision was imposed
CIR.linkedContent: foreskin & truth (detour/delay): question of knowing by whom by what the violence of circumcision was imposed

SPEC.content: Freud’s speculation, interminable detour (Umweg): qu’il décrit “lui-même,” écrit et désécrit, pas d’écriture [like Rousseau, Freud describes but doesn’t declare]
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud’s speculation, interminable detour (Umweg): qu’il décrit “lui-même,” écrit et désécrit, pas d’écriture [like Rousseau, Freud describes but doesn’t declare]

SPEC.content: when master (PP) submits to the work of the secondary (RP), “submits” to its own lieutenant, addresses to himself simulated engagement via detour of institutional telecommunication—il s’envoie, il s’écrit, PP déchaine en lui l’autre absolu > alterity more irreducible than alterity of opposition
SPEC.linkedContent: when master (PP) submits to the work of the secondary (RP), “submits” to its own lieutenant, addresses to himself simulated engagement via detour of institutional telecommunication—il s’envoie, il s’écrit, PP déchaine en lui l’autre absolu > alterity more irreducible than alterity of opposition

SPEC.content: detour, Umweg, breaks open the path (frayage) > Freud does not interrogate the graphics of the différant detour for itself (can it ever be for itself?)
SPEC.linkedContent: detour, Umweg, breaks open the path (frayage) > Freud does not interrogate the graphics of the différant detour for itself (can it ever be for itself?)

SPEC.content: [re: Freud’s “speculative” writing] démarche of this writing, advancing w/out advancing, time of a detour, pas de thèse repeats itself: PP will not let anything be done w/out it, except repetition itself
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: Freud’s “speculative” writing] démarche of this writing, advancing w/out advancing, time of a detour, pas de thèse repeats itself: PP will not let anything be done w/out it, except repetition itself

SPEC.content: Wiederholungszwang (repetition compulsion) put in communication w/ death drive
fort/da: scene of writing that Freud’s playing, plays itself, plays him
SPEC.linkedContent: fort/da: scene of writing that Freud’s playing, plays itself, plays him

SPEC.content: detour of the télé, an entire chaine (network) [play w/ Television]
SPEC.linkedContent: detour of the télé, an entire chaine (network) [play w/ Television]

SPEC.content: Vorbilder (models), necessity of metaphoric detour whenever Freud doesn’t know what he’s talking about re: interminable band, contra-band, quantity of binding—so he uses rhetoric of code, message, envoi, postal network
SPEC.linkedContent: Vorbilder (models), necessity of metaphoric detour whenever Freud doesn’t know what he’s talking about re: interminable band, contra-band, quantity of binding—so he uses rhetoric of code, message, envoi, postal network

SPEC.content: detour expanding immeasurably: Umweg of 1st Chapter [re: Freud’s Beyond…] secondary to absolute/unconditional Umweg > pas de détour always leads back to death, not a question of going (aller) but of coming back (revenir)—this is the passage
SPEC.linkedContent: detour expanding immeasurably: Umweg of 1st Chapter [re: Freud’s Beyond…] secondary to absolute/unconditional Umweg > pas de détour always leads back to death, not a question of going (aller) but of coming back (revenir)—this is the passage

SPEC.content: Weg (is) Umweg, weg as adverb signifies “far away,” fort!, go away!
SPEC.linkedContent: Weg (is) Umweg, weg as adverb signifies “far away,” fort!, go away!

SPEC.content: race to death, exhausts couriers, witnesses, relays, from post to post
SPEC.linkedContent: race to death, exhausts couriers, witnesses, relays, from post to post

SPEC.content: partial drive: assists in death, return closest to oneself as if to one’s origin, s’envoyer > in the pas de détour, organism guards against the other stealing death from it: to be the facteur of its death
SPEC.linkedContent: partial drive: assists in death, return closest to oneself as if to one’s origin, s’envoyer > in the pas de détour, organism guards against the other stealing death from it: to be the facteur of its death

FV.content: Derrida on Lacan: circulation, acquitting of a debt, a proper place [not naive, empirical topology], detour from [woman’s] hole to itself permits signified to return to its origin—indivisible locality, signifier must never be lost, divided, fragmented
FV.linkedContent: Derrida on Lacan: circulation, acquitting of a debt, a proper place [not naive, empirical topology], detour from [woman’s] hole to itself permits signified to return to its origin—indivisible locality, signifier must never be lost, divided, fragmented

FV.content: Lacan’s highly classical interpretation of mimesis: Dichtung as detour toward truth, more truth in fiction, fiction manifests the truth [i.e. for Lacan, truth is not a fiction]
FV.linkedContent: Lacan’s highly classical interpretation of mimesis: Dichtung as detour toward truth, more truth in fiction, fiction manifests the truth [i.e. for Lacan, truth is not a fiction]
